intro: Chrysopsis hispida var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and hairy, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and dry slopes. Its botanical features include upright stems and small, clustered inflorescences. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
